lead_paragraph: Thiago Pereira of Brazil broke the 40-year-old record of the American star Mark Spitz with six swimming gold medals in one Pan American Games in Rio de Janeiro.Pareira won the men’s 200-meter breaststroke yesterday to earn his sixth gold medal. He finished the race in 2 minutes 13.51 seconds, beating his teammate Henrique Barbosa (2:13.83) and Scott Spann (2.13.98) of the United States.Spitz won five gold medals at the 1967 Pan Ams in Winnipeg, Manitoba. He was 17 at the time; Pereira is 21.Spitz holds the record of seven Olympic gold medals won at the 1972 Munich Games.On Friday, Pereira won the 200 medley and took the gold medal in the 400 freestyle relay even though he did not swim in the final. By swimming a leg in the qualifying race, he was entitled to a gold medal when the Brazilian team won the final.Earlier in the Pan Ams, he won the 200 backstroke, the 400 individual medley and the 800 freestyle relay. He has also set four Pan Am Games records.Pereira, ranked fourth in the world in the 200 medley, has a chance to win two more medals in Rio.In 1967, Spitz won the 100 and 200 butterfly and three relays: the 400 free, 400 medley and 800 free.
